author: Mobile Guru

author: Rich D
comment: Does exactly as described with great support. (just like all the apps from this developer)

author: Fionn Anderson
comment: Needs an action to trigger a voice recognition process on the watch, isolated to just that task. Basically I'm trying to make a parrot to mess with people

author: Curtis H
comment: It was my go-to before author got greedy.  Now he wants me to pay again every month for functionality I already paid for.  Never.  Use Autovoice, use Shortcuts to avoid extra verbage.  It is faster and more customizable anyways.  I was already having to use shortcuts with Tasker Now to shut up google before Tasker Now dismissed it anyways.  Edit: Pixel XL here, so for us Google Now is not an option, Google Assistant or nothing.  Considering I paid for the functionality to work with Google Assistant once, months ago, why would I pay it again every month after it was disabled in what I already pay for, when I can use a competing utility I already own?  Suit yourselves but I'm not buying into the subscription model for this or any other app.  And I'm a developer, so I understand the economics of it.  Edit: fair enough, a refund would be fine

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: The previous version was based on accessibility service and sometimes didn't work. Now there is a new integration. It requires a web endpoint. I'm sorry for the change, I didn't like too, but I didn't find another way. The only thing I can offer to you is a refund of what you paid or a credit reload. Ediit: you need to send me your order id.

comment: Is it possible to get it working while de device is lock or even sleeping.. great app by the way..

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: What are you using? Google now? Google Assistant?

author: agung deppe
comment: would be awesome if statement to be matched can be more than one, so i don't have to create more profiles in tasker..thanks.

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: You can use regex. Press the pen icon in upper right corner.

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: Try to uninstall the app. It's not my fault but a play store problem, a negative review is not worth, just because you need to ask to Google not me.

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: You need to use AirTask plugin to use wake on lan to turn on your pc

comment: I use this app to match spoken task like 'turn the lights on' ,which is used to send a webrequest go an ESP8266. Extremely awesome and affordable!

author: live better
comment: Wanna buy this app

author: Patrik Olson
comment: Really great app. Only downside is that written commands are not intercepted on my device.

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: Written commands should work. Check the app configuration, there is an option in Tasker Now. In addition when you write something you need to press enter and *then* the command is executed. The text is not read if the keyboard is open.

author: Trevor Kauf
comment: Doesn't seem to work with Google Assistant

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: With version 6.0.0 is now possible to use Google Assistant

title: Google Assistant

author: Logan Fury
comment: This is an amazing app. Many solid, stable Tasker  plugins are avail, but unfortunately, im using a problematic combination of older Samsung Note 3 phone and newest Lollipop OS. This causes an environment that refuses to cooperate with many fine Tasker plugins. Enter Tasker Now. This program achieves its user's goals correctly and consistently where other plugins struggle or outright fail. The use and gui are easy and intuitive, allowing for more and more advanced options the deeper you delve into the program. Customer support is absolutely incredible. Pro upgrade was the best $1.08 ive recently spent, and is unbelievably inexpensive given the scope and possibilities of this app. Any fan of Tasker, especially ones struggling with the difficulties of older Samsungs, owe it to themselves to experience the fun of expanding custom control of your smartphone with this app.

author: Aaron Unpublished
comment: Awesome app and just works! Thank you!

author: Ashish Shukla
comment: Is it possible to intercept voice commands from in-navigation voice control ?  Works perfect but tasker now is supposed to be used mostly during car mode. And in car mode mostly navigation is running.  In navigation when you talk to google, it is triggers in-navigation voice control, which renders this app useless when most needed.   Will add 5 stars when it starts working in-navigaton.

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: No it doesn't work in that way, sorry.

author: Vinni C
comment: Anyway to back out of the Google search once tasker now has triggered an event?  No matter what I do in tasker it wrought back out or even kill it.

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: If you create an event there is an option to "close" Google Now, you can or cannot check that option. It's only thing I can say.

author: Alexander Bukharov
comment: I activate Google Now with the Bluetooth button. When the screen is on everything works perfectly. When I press the button with the screen off Google Now launches but the plugin doesn't intercept anything. Any suggestions?

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: Tasker Now can work only with screen off. Delete default settings about app opened with BT button, keep screen on and unlocked, press by button, select Tasker Now and then Always button.

title: Strange behaviour

author: Matt Pieterick
comment: Have tried similar apps with the same intent to no avail. But this works perfectly. Would like to see the option for an or function within a single event (I.e execute task if phrase x or phrase y is used)

reply.author: Marco Stornelli
reply.content: On OK. You can obviously create different profiles, or you could use regular expression or the template rules. For example you can write "Hi {Matt|Mark}" using regular expression. It matches Hi Matt OR Hi Mark
